result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian S Schicker

records.addlTxt: Plea date on November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Request and Response Regarding Open Records - documents mailed 06-10-2022

11:10 AM Defendant Brian S Schicker appeared by video, in custody from the Outagamie Jail.  Attorney Ann M. Larson appeared by video for Brian S Schicker.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Inducement made. Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over for further proceedings.  Arraignment held. Defendant waives the reading of the Information. Not guilty plea entered to the charge(s) contained in the Information. Defendant waives right to substitution.  States offer to be given to defense/defendant by July 8, 2022.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.

1:34 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian S. Schicker appearing by video, in custody at Outagamie County Jail.  Attorney Nathan Heim appearing in person for defendant.   Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 06-02-22 at 11:00 a.m.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture returned as undeliverable. Unable to forward.
Warrant cancelled and returned to Clerk of Court
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.

The Court hereby ordered that the warrant issued on May 3, 2022 is withdrawn & quashed due to the fact that Mr. Schicker has been in custody in the Outagamie County Jail.   The initial appearance in this case is now scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 2.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Copies to DA and defendant.

1:59 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian S Schicker not in court.  Attorney Carl Knepel in court for Brian S Schicker.  State requests warrant and forfeiture of bail.  Court authorizes warrant and forfeiture of bail.
Ann Larson, public defender.

Initial appearance is reset to 05-02-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel.   
Minutes.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, repeater, on 03-26-22.
$100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Order to report to TRPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess drug paraphernalia, bail jumping and 2 cts. felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-04-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.
Minutes.
